thread.title: Arkansas' bowl hopes alive despite first-half disappointment
thread.title_full: Arkansas' bowl hopes alive despite first-half disappointment

author: Kurt Voigt
title: Arkansas' bowl hopes alive despite first-half disappointment
text:
Arkansas' bowl hopes alive despite first-half disappointment Posted: October 16, 2015 - 10:53pm By Kurt Voigt AP SPORTS WRITER 
FAYETTEVILLE — Very little has gone as hoped or planned so far this season for an Arkansas team that began the season ranked before falling back to the bottom of the Southeastern Conference for a third straight year. Coach Bret Bielema insists the Razorbacks (2-4, 1-2 SEC) have made progress and are keeping hopes alive of making a bowl game for a second straight year. Arkansas enters this weekend with its lone bye of the season following a disappointing six-game stretch. The combined record of the teams Arkansas lost to this year is 19-3, though that’s of little comfort for a weary Razorbacks fan base that thought the program had returned to SEC relevance following a strong finish to last season.
